question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Russian athletes being barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current geopolitical situation: The ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine has led to widespread international sanctions against Russia, including in the sports world. 2. Historical precedent: Russian athletes were banned from competing under their national flag at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics and 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics due to doping scandals. They competed under the Russian Olympic Committee (ROC) flag. 3. International Olympic Committee (IOC) stance: In February 2023, the IOC announced it was exploring a pathway for Russian and Belarusian athletes to compete as neutral athletes, not representing their countries. 4. Opposition from other countries: Several nations, including Ukraine, Poland, and the Baltic states, have threatened to boycott the Olympics if Russian athletes are allowed to compete. 5. Time until the event: The 2024 Olympics are still more than a year away, which allows time for potential diplomatic solutions or changes in the geopolitical landscape. 6. Pressure from sponsors and public opinion: There is significant pressure on the IOC from various stakeholders to maintain a hard stance against Russian participation. 7. The specific criteria set in the question: The question resolves as 'Yes' if no more than 34 Russian athletes compete, which is a relatively low threshold. Given these factors, it seems more likely than not that Russian athletes will be barred from competing or severely restricted in their participation. The IOC's exploration of a neutral athlete pathway suggests they are trying to find a compromise, but the strong opposition from other countries and the ongoing conflict make it difficult to imagine a large Russian contingent at the Games. The low threshold of 34 athletes for a 'Yes' resolution also increases the likelihood of this outcome. Even if some Russian athletes are allowed to compete as neutral individuals, it's probable that the number will be kept low to appease opposing countries and maintain the integrity of the Games. However, there is still uncertainty due to the time remaining before the Olympics and the potential for diplomatic developments.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will also resolve NO if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

However, they have shown openness to ethical considerations in AI development. 3. Industry trends: There's growing pressure in the AI industry for more transparency and ethical practices. This could influence OpenAI's decision. 4. Public perception: Adopting this principle could be seen as a positive PR move for OpenAI, potentially improving their public image. 5. Potential drawbacks: OpenAI might be hesitant to commit to such a principle if they believe it could lead to uncontrolled information leaks or misuse of their disclosure policies. 6. Verification requirement: The question requires verification from Metaculus and satisfaction from at least one member of righttowarn.ai, which adds an additional layer of complexity. 7. OpenAI's history: The company has shown willingness to engage with ethical concerns in the past, but has also faced criticism for lack of transparency in some areas. Given these factors, I believe there's a moderate chance of this occurring. The growing emphasis on AI ethics and transparency in the industry could push OpenAI in this direction. However, the specific requirements of the commitment and the need for verification make it less certain.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

However, the specific requirements (45+ minutes of new footage, in-person) and potential concerns about stamina or gaffes in a long-form setting introduce some uncertainty.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Tim Scott becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current standing: As of now, Tim Scott is not a frontrunner in the Republican primary race. He officially announced his candidacy on May 22, 2023, but he's polling significantly behind other candidates like Donald Trump and Ron DeSantis. 2. Name recognition: While Scott is a U.S. Senator from South Carolina, he doesn't have the same level of national recognition as some other candidates. This could make it challenging for him to gain widespread support. 3. Fundraising: Scott has shown some strength in fundraising, which is crucial for a successful campaign. However, he's still behind top-tier candidates in this aspect. 4. Political experience: Scott has experience as a Senator and has been involved in national politics, which is beneficial. However, he lacks executive experience (such as being a governor) which is often seen as valuable for presidential candidates. 5. Demographic appeal: As an African American conservative, Scott could potentially broaden the Republican base. However, it's unclear if this will translate into significant primary support. 6. Competition: The field is crowded with high-profile candidates like Donald Trump, Ron DeSantis, and others. Overcoming these well-known figures will be a significant challenge. 7. Time until convention: There's still a considerable amount of time until the Republican National Convention in 2024. While this gives Scott time to build support, it also leaves room for many unpredictable events that could shape the race. 8. Current polling: As of the latest polls, Scott is significantly behind the leading candidates. While polls can change, overcoming such a large gap is historically uncommon. Given these factors, while it's not impossible for Tim Scott to become the nominee, it appears highly unlikely at this point. The dominance of other candidates in the race, particularly Trump and DeSantis, makes Scott's path to the nomination extremely challenging.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this scenario, we need to consider several factors: 1. Electoral performance: Both parties have faced challenges in recent elections, which might push them to consider alliances to remain competitive. 4. Given these factors, while it's not impossible for such an alliance to form, it seems unlikely. The ideological differences, potential backlash from moderate voters, and internal party resistance are significant obstacles. question.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this event, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical precedent: Venezuela has a history of delayed and disputed election results. In recent years, the government has been criticized for lack of transparency in electoral processes. 2. Time frame: The question asks about results being published within 15 days of the election. This is a relatively short period for full, disaggregated results to be compiled and released, especially given Venezuela's current political climate. 3. Level of detail required: The question specifies that results must be disaggregated to the parish level. This level of detail adds complexity to the tabulation and reporting process. 4. Political climate: Venezuela is currently experiencing political tensions and international scrutiny. The government may be hesitant to release detailed results quickly if they are unfavorable to the ruling party. 5. Technical capacity: Venezuela's electoral commission may face logistical and technical challenges in compiling and publishing detailed results quickly, given the country's economic difficulties. 6. International pressure: There may be international pressure for transparency, which could encourage faster publication of results. However, the Venezuelan government has often resisted such pressure in the past. 7. Potential for disputes: If the election is close or contested, there may be delays in finalizing and publishing results. Given these factors, it seems more likely than not that the full, parish-level results will not be published within the specified timeframe. The combination of potential political motivations for delay, technical challenges, and the short time frame make it more probable that the results will not be fully published before August 12, 2024.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: In recent Olympics, it's been relatively common for a single nation to win multiple women's team sport gold medals. For example, in the 2020 Tokyo Olympics, the United States won gold in both women's basketball (5x5) and women's volleyball. 2. Dominant nations in women's team sports: Some countries have consistently strong performances across multiple team sports. The United States, for instance, is a powerhouse in basketball, volleyball, and soccer. Australia is strong in basketball and rugby sevens. The Netherlands excels in field hockey. 3. Diversity of sports: The eight sports listed cover a wide range of skills and physical attributes, which makes it less likely for a single nation to dominate across all of them. This increases the chances of different countries winning in different sports. 4. Number of sports: With eight different sports, there are many opportunities for different countries to win gold. However, it only takes one country winning two golds for the question to resolve as "Yes". 5. Competitive balance: Women's team sports have become increasingly competitive globally, with more nations developing strong programs. This could lead to a more even distribution of gold medals. 6. Short time frame for resolution: The question resolves relatively quickly after the start of the Olympics, which means we won't have to wait long to know the outcome. Given these factors, I believe it's more likely than not that at least one nation will win more than one women's team sport gold medal. The historical precedent, the existence of countries with strong programs across multiple sports, and the fact that only two wins are needed for a "Yes" resolution all point in this direction. However, the increasing global competitiveness and the diversity of sports do provide a significant chance for eight different countries to win gold medals.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

Director: Lee Isaac Chung is known for his critically acclaimed film 'Minari' (2020), which received a 98% Rotten Tomatoes score. This suggests he has the ability to create well-received films. 2. Cast: Glen Powell and Daisy Edgar Jones are both rising stars with good reputations. Powell's performance in 'Top Gun: Maverick' (96% on Rotten Tomatoes) and Edgar Jones' in 'Normal People' (91% on Rotten Tomatoes) were well-received. 3. Sequel factor: As a standalone sequel to the 1996 'Twister,' there's a built-in audience and nostalgia factor. However, sequels can be hit-or-miss with critics. 4. Original film's reception: The 1996 'Twister' has a 63% Rotten Tomatoes score. While not terrible, it suggests room for improvement in the sequel. 5. Genre: Disaster movies often prioritize spectacle over critical acclaim. They can be entertaining but don't always score high with critics. 6. Modern visual effects: With nearly 30 years of technological advancements since the original, the visual effects are likely to be impressive, which could positively influence critics' opinions. 7. Cultural relevance: Given the increasing frequency and severity of extreme weather events due to climate change, the film's subject matter could resonate with critics if handled well. 8. Studio backing: As a major studio production (Universal Pictures), it's likely to have a substantial budget and marketing push, which doesn't directly influence quality but can help in production value. Considering these factors, there are reasons to be optimistic about the film's critical reception. The director's track record and the cast's recent successes are particularly encouraging. However, the genre and sequel nature of the film present challenges in achieving a very high critical score. The 75% threshold for 'Certified Fresh' is quite high and not easily achieved, especially for this type of film. While I believe 'Twisters' has a good chance of surpassing the original's 63% score, reaching 75% is less certain.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this event occurring, we need to consider several factors: 1. Existing opposition: The context already mentions that "dozens" of House Democrats are organizing to speak out against the early nomination plan. This suggests there is significant opposition within the party. 2. Time frame: The market closes on July 21st, which gives about 5 days from the creation date for this letter to be drafted, circulated, and signed. This is a relatively short time frame, but not impossible for motivated lawmakers. 3. Number of signatures required: The threshold of 20 signatures is relatively low, considering there are currently 213 Democratic Representatives in the House and 48 Democratic Senators (plus 3 Independents who caucus with Democrats). 4. Motivation: The context suggests that many Democrats are "deeply unsettled" about Biden's candidacy. This could provide strong motivation to sign such a letter. 5. Political risk: Signing a letter opposing the party's plan could be seen as a risky move for some Democrats, potentially affecting their standing within the party or future support. 6. Precedent: The fact that Rep. Jared Huffman has already drafted a letter indicates that there is concrete action being taken, not just discussion. 7. Public nature: The requirement for the letter to be public might deter some lawmakers who prefer to voice their concerns privately. Given these factors, it seems quite likely that at least 20 Democrats would sign such a letter. The existing opposition, the low threshold of signatures required, and the strong motivations suggest a high probability of success. However, the short time frame and potential political risks introduce some uncertainty.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this event, we need to consider several factors: 1. Credibility of the source: The New York Times is a reputable news source, which lends credibility to the report. 2. Nature of the event: Political rallies, especially for high-profile figures like Trump, are typically high-security events. This makes an intentional shooting attempt more difficult, but not impossible. 3. Ambiguity in the report: The report says "It sounded what could be gun shots," which suggests uncertainty about whether actual gunshots occurred. 4. Trump's reaction: The fact that Trump was hurried off stage suggests that security personnel perceived a genuine threat. 5. Reported injury: The mention of Trump appearing to bleed by his ear could indicate that something did hit him, but it's not clear if it was a bullet or something else. 6. Time frame: The question was created on the same day as the alleged incident, which means there might not have been enough time for a thorough investigation or confirmation of details. 7. Historical context: While there have been assassination attempts on political figures in the past, they are relatively rare events. 8. Alternative explanations: The sound could have been from something else (e.g., a car backfiring, fireworks), and the bleeding could have been from an unrelated minor injury. Given these factors, it seems that while something did occur at the rally that caused concern, there's significant uncertainty about whether it was an intentional shooting attempt. The bleeding suggests that Trump may have been hit by something, but it's not clear if it was a "bullet-like projectile" as defined in the question. The hurried response of security and the reported injury increase the likelihood that this was a genuine threat, but the ambiguity in the initial report and the rarity of such events work against a high probability. Probability: 0.35 This probability reflects that while there is some evidence supporting the possibility of an intentional shooting, there is still significant uncertainty, and alternative explanations are plausible. The probability is below 0.5 because, given the limited information and the rarity of such events, it seems more likely that this was not an intentional shooting attempt, but rather a misunderstanding or a less severe security incident.

question.title: Will San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of San Marino qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: San Marino has participated in Eurovision since 2008 but has only qualified for the Grand Final three times (2014, 2019, and 2021). This suggests a relatively low success rate. 2. Recent performance: San Marino failed to qualify for the Grand Final in both 2022 and 2023, indicating a downward trend in their Eurovision success. 3. Country size and resources: San Marino is one of the smallest countries participating in Eurovision, which can limit its resources for producing competitive entries and mounting elaborate stage performances. 4. Voting patterns: San Marino often struggles to gather enough votes from both juries and televoting due to its small size and limited cultural influence across Europe. 5. Quality of entry: While we don't know the specific entry for 2024 yet, San Marino's entries have been inconsistent in quality over the years, which affects their chances of qualification. 6. Competition level: The overall quality of entries in Eurovision has been increasing, making it more challenging for smaller countries like San Marino to stand out. 7. Semi-final draw: The allocation of countries in each semi-final can impact qualification chances, but this information is not available at the time of this assessment. 8. Potential changes in approach: There's always a possibility that San Marino could change its selection process or invest more resources into its Eurovision participation, which could improve its chances. Given these factors, particularly San Marino's historical performance and recent struggles, the chances of qualification appear to be relatively low. However, Eurovision results can be unpredictable, and there's always a possibility of a surprise qualification with a strong entry or favorable circumstances.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Liz Cheney becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current political landscape: Liz Cheney has been a vocal critic of former President Donald Trump and voted to impeach him. This has put her at odds with a significant portion of the Republican base that still strongly supports Trump. 2. Recent political history: Cheney lost her leadership position in the House Republican Conference and was censured by the Republican National Committee for her stance against Trump and her participation in the January 6th committee. 3. Primary challenge: Cheney lost her 2022 primary for Wyoming's at-large congressional district to a Trump-backed challenger, indicating a lack of support from her own state's Republican voters. 4. Current polling: Cheney is not currently a frontrunner in any national polls for the 2024 Republican nomination. Candidates like Donald Trump, Ron DeSantis, and others are consistently polling much higher. 5. Fundraising and support: While Cheney has some support from anti-Trump Republicans and even some Democrats, she lacks the broad party support and fundraising network typically needed to secure a presidential nomination. 6. Time until convention: There is still time until the 2024 Republican National Convention, but Cheney would need a dramatic shift in Republican voter sentiment to become a viable candidate. 7. Alternative paths: Cheney has hinted at potentially running as an independent or third-party candidate, which suggests she may not see a path to the Republican nomination. question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of the Pandemic Agreement being approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, we need to consider several factors: 1. Timeline: The question is asking about an event that's very close in the future (May 2024), which means there's likely to be substantial information available about the current state of negotiations and member countries' positions. 2. Previous developments: The World Health Organization (WHO) has been working on a pandemic treaty since December 2021, following the COVID-19 pandemic. There has been significant progress, but also some controversies and disagreements among member states. 3. Global health priorities: Given the recent experience with COVID-19, there's a strong impetus for better global coordination on pandemic preparedness and response. 4. Political landscape: While many countries support the idea of a pandemic agreement, some have expressed concerns about sovereignty and the binding nature of such an agreement. 5. Negotiation process: The Intergovernmental Negotiating Body (INB) has been working on drafts of the agreement. The final draft is expected to be presented at the 77th World Health Assembly in May 2024. 6. Voting process: Approval typically requires a two-thirds majority of the WHO's 194 member states. 7. Recent news: As of my last update, negotiations were ongoing, with some contentious issues still being debated. Given these factors, I believe there's a moderate to high chance of the Pandemic Agreement being approved. The global urgency for better pandemic preparedness, the long negotiation process, and the proximity to the vote date suggest that significant efforts will be made to reach a consensus. However, the potential for last-minute disagreements or holdouts from some countries cannot be discounted.

question.title: Will Bayern Munich win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if Bayern Munich wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams resolve "No".

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess Bayern Munich's chances of winning the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, we need to consider several factors: 1. However, their form can change over the course of the season. 3. Squad strength: Bayern has a strong squad with world-class players like Harry Kane, Leroy Sané, and Joshua Kimmich. Knockout nature of the tournament: The Champions League's knockout format means that even strong teams can be eliminated by a single poor performance or unlucky match. 6. Time until resolution: The final is on June 1, 2024, which is about 7 months away. A lot can change in terms of form, injuries, and other factors during this period. 7. Coaching: Thomas Tuchel is an experienced coach who has won the Champions League before (with Chelsea in 2021), which is a positive factor. Given these factors, Bayern Munich has a strong chance of winning, but it's far from certain. They are likely to be among the favorites, but probably not the outright favorite. The competition is fierce, and there are many variables that could affect the outcome. Considering all these aspects, I would estimate their chances as good but not overwhelmingly so.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current polling trends: As of July 5, 2024, Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points according to 538's national polling average. This is within the range specified in the question (between 2 and 4 points). 2. Time frame: We're looking at the polling average on July 15, 2024, which is only 10 days from the last known data point. In such a short time, significant changes in polling are less likely unless major events occur. 3. Historical volatility: Presidential polls tend to fluctuate, but usually within a relatively narrow range, especially as the election approaches. A shift of 0.6 points in either direction over 10 days is plausible. 4. Potential events: We should consider the possibility of significant events occurring between July 5 and July 15 that could impact the polls. However, without specific information about such events, we should assume relative stability. 5. Polling methodology: 538's polling average is generally considered reliable and tends to smooth out short-term fluctuations. 6. Election dynamics: As the election nears, undecided voters may start to make up their minds, which could cause some movement in the polls. Given these factors, it seems reasonably likely that Trump's lead will remain within the 2 to 4 point range. The current 2.4 point lead is already within this range, and while there's a possibility of movement outside this range, it's not highly probable in such a short time frame without major events. However, we must also consider the possibility of the lead falling below 2 points or rising above 4 points. Given the current 2.4 point lead, there's a slightly higher chance of the lead falling below 2 points than rising above 4 points. Considering all these factors, I estimate there's about a 60% chance that Trump's lead will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of President Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current health status: As of now, there are no publicly known severe health issues that would warrant such a drastic measure. Biden, while the oldest serving president, has maintained an active schedule and has not shown signs of significant physical or mental incapacity. 2. Political climate: The invocation of the 25th Amendment Section 4 is an extremely rare and serious action. It would require the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet to agree on this course of action, which seems highly unlikely given the current political landscape and the loyalty of Biden's administration. 3. Recent context: The question mentions a GOP lawmaker asking Attorney General Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment. However, this appears to be more of a political move rather than a genuine concern about the President's capacity. Such calls from opposition party members are not uncommon and rarely lead to action. 4. Time frame: The resolution date is set for August 2, 2024, which is less than a month away from the current date. The likelihood of such a significant event occurring in this short timeframe is very low. 5. Historical precedent: The 25th Amendment Section 4 has never been invoked in U.S. history. The bar for its use is extremely high, requiring clear and convincing evidence of the President's inability to discharge the powers and duties of the office. 6. Biden's support system: The President has a strong support system within his administration and party. Any signs of incapacity would likely be managed internally before reaching the point of invoking the 25th Amendment. 7. Upcoming election: With the 2024 presidential election approaching, it's in the Democratic Party's interest to maintain stability and avoid any actions that could be seen as undermining their incumbent president. Given these factors, the probability of President Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 is extremely low. While it's not impossible, it would require an unforeseen and severe deterioration in Biden's health or mental capacity, coupled with a rapid consensus among his administration to take this unprecedented step.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this question resolving YES, we need to consider several factors: 1. He continues to perform his duties and make public appearances regularly. 2. Political climate: While there have been calls from some GOP lawmakers to invoke the 25th Amendment, these appear to be more politically motivated rather than based on genuine concerns about Biden's capacity to serve. The Democratic party, which controls the executive branch, has shown no indication of considering such a move. 3. Cabinet support: For Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to be invoked, it requires the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet to agree. There have been no signs of dissent or concern from Biden's Cabinet members regarding his ability to serve. 4. Time frame: The question asks about the period from now until August 2024, which is a relatively short time frame (about a month). Barring any sudden and severe health issues, it's unlikely that such a significant political action would occur in this short period. 5. Historical precedent: The 25th Amendment Section 4 has never been invoked in U.S. history. Its use would be an extraordinary event and would likely only occur in extreme circumstances. 6. Legal and procedural hurdles: The process of invoking Section 4 is complex and would face significant scrutiny. It's not a decision that would be made lightly or quickly. 7. Public perception: While there are critics of Biden's age and occasional gaffes, there isn't widespread public sentiment that he is incapacitated to the degree that would warrant such an extreme measure. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that Biden would be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. The political, procedural, and practical barriers to such an action are substantial, and there's no strong evidence suggesting Biden is unable to discharge his duties as President.

question.title: Will Blake Lively's "It Ends With Us" outgross her husband Ryan Reynold's "Deadpool & Wolverine" this weekend?

This market resolves YES "It Ends with Us" has a higher (domestic) gross than "Deadpool & Wolverine" for the weekend of August 9-11. 

Source: The "weekend" tab in BoxOfficeMojo, for August 9-11.

Marketing and Distribution: Without more information, it's hard to gauge the marketing push behind 'It Ends With Us,' but it's unlikely to match the promotional effort of a major superhero franchise film. 8. Timing: By its third weekend, 'Deadpool & Wolverine' might see a significant drop in earnings, but given its strong start, it would still likely be earning substantial amounts. Considering all these factors, it seems highly unlikely that 'It Ends With Us' would outgross 'Deadpool & Wolverine' on the specified weekend. While surprises can happen in the box office, the evidence strongly suggests that 'Deadpool & Wolverine' will maintain its lead.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Asa Hutchinson becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current political landscape: The Republican field for 2024 is already crowded with high-profile candidates like Donald Trump, Ron DeSantis, and Nikki Haley. These candidates have significantly more name recognition and support within the party. 2. Hutchinson's profile: While Asa Hutchinson is a former governor of Arkansas and has experience in federal positions, he is not as well-known nationally as many of his competitors. 3. Polling data: Current polls show Hutchinson with very low support among Republican voters, often polling at 1% or less. 4. Fundraising: Hutchinson's campaign has not demonstrated the ability to raise substantial funds compared to frontrunners like Trump and DeSantis. 5. Party dynamics: The Republican Party base currently seems to favor candidates who align closely with Trump's policies and style, which Hutchinson does not. 6. Time until convention: While there is still time for dynamics to change before the Republican National Convention, it would require a massive shift in voter preferences and party dynamics for Hutchinson to emerge as the nominee. 7. Historical precedent: It is extremely rare for a candidate polling so low this far out from the convention to eventually become the nominee. Given these factors, the probability of Asa Hutchinson becoming the Republican nominee is extremely low. While not impossible, it would require an extraordinary and unprecedented series of events for this to occur.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical data: In recent Summer Olympics, the number of world records broken has varied: - 2016 Rio Olympics: 27 world records - 2012 London Olympics: 32 world records - 2008 Beijing Olympics: 43 world records 2. Technological advancements: Improvements in equipment, training methods, and sports science continue to push the boundaries of human performance. 3. Time since the last Olympics: The Tokyo 2020 Olympics were held in 2021 due to the COVID-19 pandemic, giving athletes an extra year to train and improve between Olympics. 4. Paris 2024 specifics: - New sports added: Breaking (breakdancing) is being introduced, which could potentially see new world records set. - Environmental factors: Paris's climate in summer is generally favorable for athletic performance. 5. Increased competition: The global pool of elite athletes continues to grow, increasing the likelihood of exceptional performances. 6. Anti-doping efforts: Stricter testing may lead to cleaner competition, potentially making it harder to break records. 7. COVID-19 impact: While the pandemic's immediate effects will have lessened by 2024, it may have had long-term impacts on athlete development and training. Considering these factors, it seems likely that at least 24 world records will be broken. The historical trend shows that recent Olympics have consistently seen more than 24 world records broken. While there's a slight downward trend in the number of records broken per Olympics, the additional year of preparation due to the Tokyo Olympics delay and the introduction of new sports could counteract this. The continued advancement in sports science, technology, and training methods, combined with the ever-increasing pool of elite athletes, suggests that we will continue to see impressive performances pushing the boundaries of human capability. However, it's important to note that breaking world records becomes increasingly difficult over time as humans approach the limits of physical performance. Despite this, the threshold of 24 records seems achievable based on recent Olympic performances.

question.title: Will UCLA not hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) does not hold all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 as scheduled for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The question will resolve as **Yes** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

This question will resolve as **No** if all ceremonies occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of UCLA not holding its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies as scheduled on June 14, 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical precedent: UCLA has a long-standing tradition of holding these ceremonies, and they are typically well-organized and executed as planned. 2. Time until the event: The question is being asked about a year in advance. This gives the university ample time to plan and prepare for the ceremonies, reducing the likelihood of last-minute changes or cancellations. 3. Potential disruptions: We need to consider possible reasons why the ceremonies might not be held as scheduled: a) Natural disasters: While California is prone to earthquakes and wildfires, the likelihood of a major event specifically affecting UCLA on June 14, 2024, is relatively low. b) Public health concerns: The COVID-19 pandemic caused disruptions to many events in recent years. However, as of 2023, most institutions have returned to normal operations, and it's unlikely that a similar situation would arise in 2024. c) Venue issues: The Pauley Pavilion is a well-maintained facility, and major renovations or structural issues are unlikely to occur without advance notice. d) Administrative decisions: There's always a small chance that the university administration might decide to change the format or timing of the ceremonies, but this is uncommon for such a significant event. 4. Flexibility in resolution criteria: The question allows for a one-hour buffer in start times, which provides some leeway for minor delays. 5. Multiple ceremonies: For the question to resolve as Yes, all three ceremonies would need to be affected, which is less likely than just one ceremony being disrupted. Given these factors, it seems highly probable that UCLA will hold its graduation ceremonies as scheduled. The university has strong incentives to maintain this important tradition, and there are no apparent reasons to expect significant disruptions. However, we must account for unforeseen circumstances and the inherent uncertainty in predicting events a year in advance. While the probability of the ceremonies not occurring as planned is low, it's not zero.

question.title: Will there be a break between Chainsaw Man chapters 173 and 174?
question.body:
A break can be any amount of time, enough for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one.

“YES” = “Yes, there will be a break after chapter 173”

“NO” = “No, there will not be a break after chapter 173”

Plan to close this on official release, will close earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time. I do not vote in my own questions.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors related to the publication of Chainsaw Man manga: 1. Publication schedule: Chainsaw Man is serialized in Weekly Shonen Jump, which typically releases new chapters weekly. However, breaks are not uncommon in manga serialization. 2. Author's work pattern: Tatsuki Fujimoto, the creator of Chainsaw Man, has taken breaks between chapters in the past. This is often done to maintain quality, avoid burnout, or for health reasons. 3. Timing: The question is asked on July 25, 2024, and the resolution date is set for August 6, 2024. This gives about two weeks for chapters 173 and 174 to be released. 4. Previous patterns: Without specific information about recent breaks or announcements, it's difficult to predict with certainty. However, manga series often have breaks every 3-4 chapters or around significant story events. 5. Lack of specific information: The question doesn't provide any recent context about breaks or the author's current work schedule. Given these factors, I would lean slightly towards there being a break, but with considerable uncertainty: 1. Breaks are common in manga serialization, especially for popular series like Chainsaw Man. 2. The two-week period between the question being asked and the resolution date could accommodate a typical one-week break. 3. Without specific contrary information, it's safer to assume a break might occur, as they are a regular part of manga publication. However, the uncertainty is high due to the lack of specific recent information about the series' publication schedule or any announcements from the author or publisher.

question.title: Will Tadej Pogačar win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Tadej Pogačar winning the Tour de France 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Past performance: Pogačar won the Tour de France in 2020 and 2021, demonstrating his capability to win the most prestigious cycling race in the world. He finished second in 2022 and 2023, showing consistent top-level performance. 2. Age and peak performance: Born in 1998, Pogačar will be 25 years old during the 2024 Tour. This is typically considered within the prime age range for Grand Tour cyclists, suggesting he should be at or near his peak performance. 3. Team support: Pogačar rides for UAE Team Emirates, which has shown strong commitment to supporting him in Grand Tours. The team's continued investment in his success is a positive factor. 4. Competition: His main rival, Jonas Vingegaard, who won in 2022 and 2023, will likely be his strongest competitor. Other potential contenders include Remco Evenepoel and Primoz Roglic. The level of competition is high, which could make winning more challenging. 5. Course profile: The specific route of the 2024 Tour is not known at the time of this assessment, but Pogačar has shown versatility in different terrains, which bodes well for his chances regardless of the course. 6. Injuries and form: As of now, there are no known major injuries or setbacks for Pogačar. His current form and preparation leading up to the 2024 Tour will be crucial factors, but these are unknown at this point. 7. Motivation: After two consecutive second-place finishes, Pogačar will likely be highly motivated to reclaim the top spot. 8. Unpredictability of cycling: The sport is known for its unpredictability, with crashes, tactical decisions, and even weather potentially playing significant roles in the outcome. Considering these factors, Pogačar has a strong chance of winning, but it's far from certain. He's consistently one of the top two riders in recent years, has the right age and experience, and will likely have strong team support. However, the high level of competition and the inherent unpredictability of the sport prevent this from being a near-certainty.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current geopolitical tensions: The relationship between Israel and Iran is historically strained, with ongoing conflicts and mutual threats. The recent attack on Israel by Iran has significantly escalated tensions. 2. Time frame: The question covers a period of about 2.5 weeks from the creation date to the resolution date. This is a relatively short time frame, but given the current high tensions, it's still a significant period for potential action. 3. Historical precedent: Israel has been known to conduct covert operations and targeted strikes against perceived threats, including within Iran. However, large-scale, openly attributed attacks within Iran's borders are less common. 4. Recent events: The April 13, 2024 attack by Iran on Israel using drones and missiles has dramatically increased the likelihood of Israeli retaliation. Israel's leadership has vowed to respond, and international pressure for a measured response may push Israel towards more covert actions rather than open warfare. 5. Strategic considerations: Israel may prefer to conduct a covert operation to minimize international backlash and reduce the risk of further escalation. However, the need to send a strong deterrent message might push them towards a more overt action. 6. Logistical challenges: Carrying out an attack within Iran's borders presents significant logistical and operational challenges, which could limit Israel's options or delay potential actions. 7. International pressure: While many countries have expressed support for Israel's right to defend itself, there is also significant diplomatic pressure to avoid further escalation in the region. Given these factors, I believe there is a substantial chance that Israel will carry out an attack within Iran before May 1, 2024. The recent Iranian attack has created a situation where Israel feels compelled to respond, and the short time frame increases the likelihood of quick action. However, the logistical challenges and international pressure for restraint somewhat reduce the probability.

question.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this question resolving YES, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current geopolitical tensions: Israel and Iran have been in a state of heightened tension for years, with occasional covert operations and cyber attacks attributed to both sides. The recent attack on Iran's consulate in Damascus, attributed to Israel, has further escalated tensions. 2. Historical precedent: Israel has conducted covert operations in Iran before, but large-scale, deadly attacks within Iranian borders have been rare. Most Israeli actions against Iran have been focused on sabotage, assassinations of key figures, or cyber attacks. 3. Time frame: The question covers a relatively short period (about 2.5 weeks from the creation date to the resolution date). This limited timeframe reduces the likelihood of a major escalation occurring. 4. International pressure: The international community, including Israel's allies, would likely discourage any overt military action against Iran to prevent further destabilization in the region. 5. Iran's retaliatory capabilities: Israel is aware that a direct, deadly attack on Iranian soil could provoke a significant retaliation from Iran, potentially leading to a wider conflict. This serves as a deterrent for such actions. 6. Focus on other threats: Israel is currently engaged in conflicts on multiple fronts, particularly in Gaza. This may limit its willingness and capacity to open a new front with Iran. 7. Definition of "deadly attack": The question specifies that at least five individuals must die for it to be considered a deadly attack. This threshold makes it less likely for smaller-scale operations to qualify. Given these factors, it seems more likely that Israel will continue to focus on covert operations, cyber attacks, or actions outside of Iran's borders rather than conducting a large-scale, deadly attack within Iran in the next few weeks. However, the situation remains volatile, and unexpected events could trigger an escalation.

question.title: Will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

<iframe src="https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/embed?mid=1VCJMA9AH4k8G6v33Yr6z254_umiNe4Q&ehbc=2E312F" width="640" height="480"}}>
</iframe>

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Israel expanding its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current situation: As of April 2024, Israel has not yet launched a full-scale ground invasion of Rafah, despite previous statements about intentions to do so. 2. Strategic importance: Rafah is strategically significant as it's the last major population center in Gaza not under Israeli control and borders Egypt. It's also believed to be a stronghold for Hamas. 3. International pressure: There has been significant international pressure, including from the US, against a large-scale operation in Rafah due to the high concentration of civilians there, many of whom are displaced from other parts of Gaza. 4. Time frame: The question gives about 1.5 months for this to occur, which is a relatively short period but still allows for potential military action. 5. Israeli government stance: The Israeli government has repeatedly stated its intention to conduct operations in Rafah to eliminate Hamas, despite international concerns. 6. Ongoing negotiations: Efforts for a ceasefire and hostage release deal are ongoing, which could potentially delay or prevent a ground invasion if successful. 7. Military preparedness: Israel has been making preparations for a potential Rafah operation, including evacuating civilians, which suggests they are serious about the possibility. 8. Past patterns: Israel has generally followed through on its stated military objectives in Gaza, albeit sometimes delayed due to international pressure or strategic considerations. Given these factors, there is a significant possibility that Israel will expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024. The Israeli government seems determined to do so, and preparations are underway. However, international pressure and ongoing negotiations could delay or prevent such an action. The short time frame and the potential for last-minute diplomatic interventions or changes in the conflict dynamics slightly reduce the likelihood.

Strategic considerations: Israel may be hesitant to launch a ground invasion of Rafah due to its proximity to the Egyptian border, which could complicate diplomatic relations with Egypt. 5. This relatively short timeframe reduces the likelihood of a major operation being planned and executed. 6. Alternative strategies: Israel may opt for more targeted operations or air strikes instead of a full ground invasion to achieve its military objectives in Rafah. 7. Given these factors, it seems more likely than not that Israel will not expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024. The international pressure, humanitarian concerns, and strategic complications make a full-scale ground invasion less probable in the short term. question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this question resolving YES, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current trend: The previous polls show an increasing trend in the percentage of respondents agreeing that weak AGI has been achieved. In May, it was 15%, and in June, it rose to 27%. This upward trend suggests that the 30% threshold could be reached by July. 2. Rate of AI progress: The AI field is advancing rapidly, with new developments and improvements happening frequently. This rapid progress increases the likelihood of reaching the 30% threshold. 3. Time frame: There's about three weeks between the creation of this question and the July poll. Given the fast pace of AI development, significant advancements could occur in this period, potentially swaying more respondents. 4. Previous underestimation: The question mentions that previous markets significantly underestimated Manifold's belief in AI progress. This suggests that there might be a tendency for faster progress than anticipated. 5. Subjective nature of the poll: The poll allows respondents to use their own understanding of 'weak AGI,' which could lead to a higher percentage of YES responses as people may have varying definitions. 6. Proximity to threshold: The June poll result (27%) is already very close to the 30% threshold. Even a small increase would push it over the required percentage. 7. Potential announcements or breakthroughs: Any major AI-related announcements or breakthroughs in the weeks leading up to the July poll could significantly influence respondents' opinions. Given these factors, especially the current trend and the closeness to the threshold, it seems more likely than not that the 30% threshold will be reached. However, there's still uncertainty due to the short time frame and the unpredictable nature of AI progress.

question.title: Will "Borderlands" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B- or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Borderlands" (2024) receives a B- CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a C+ or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

"Borderlands" is the adaptation of the hugely popular video game franchise.

Here's a list of CinemaScores for previous video game adaptations.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of 'Borderlands' (2024) receiving a CinemaScore of B- or above, we need to consider several factors: 1. Video game adaptations' track record: Historically, video game adaptations have had mixed success with audiences. However, recent years have seen improvements in this genre. 2. Popularity of the source material: Borderlands is a hugely popular video game franchise with a dedicated fanbase. This could work in the movie's favor if it stays true to the source material. 3. Production quality: While we don't have specific details about the production, a high-budget adaptation with good special effects and action sequences could appeal to audiences. 4. Cast and crew: The movie features a star-studded cast including Cate Blanchett, Kevin Hart, and Jamie Lee Curtis, which could attract a wider audience and potentially lead to better reception. 5. Director: Eli Roth is known for horror films, which is an interesting choice for this action-comedy sci-fi adaptation. This could either work very well or miss the mark with audiences. 6. Recent trends: Recent video game adaptations like 'The Super Mario Bros. Movie' and 'Sonic the Hedgehog' have been well-received by audiences, potentially indicating a positive trend for the genre. 7. Tone and faithfulness: If the movie captures the humor and action of the games, it could resonate well with both fans and general audiences. 8. Marketing: A good marketing campaign that builds excitement without overpromising could lead to better audience satisfaction. Given these factors, I believe 'Borderlands' has a good chance of receiving a CinemaScore of B- or above. The popularity of the franchise, star power of the cast, and recent positive trends in video game adaptations work in its favor. However, the challenge of adapting the game's unique style and humor, along with the director's background primarily in horror, introduce some uncertainty.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of 'Deadpool & Wolverine' having a higher domestic box office opening than the combined openings of 'Deadpool' and 'The Wolverine,' we need to consider several factors: 1. Franchise popularity: Both Deadpool and Wolverine are extremely popular characters in the Marvel universe, with strong fan bases. 2. Previous performance: 'Deadpool' had an impressive opening of $132,434,639, while 'The Wolverine' opened at $53,113,752. The combined target to beat is $185,548,391. 3. Synergy effect: Combining these two popular characters in one film is likely to create significant buzz and attract fans of both characters, potentially leading to a larger audience than either character alone. 4. Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) integration: With Disney's acquisition of Fox, this film is expected to be part of the MCU, which could further boost its appeal to a wider audience. 5. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman: The star power and chemistry between these two actors, who are reprising their roles, is likely to be a major draw. 6. Marketing and hype: Given the popularity of both characters and the MCU connection, the marketing campaign is likely to be extensive and effective. 7. Post-pandemic box office recovery: By 2024, the movie industry is expected to have largely recovered from the pandemic slump, potentially leading to higher box office numbers. 8. Inflation: Ticket prices in 2024 will likely be higher than in 2013 and 2016, which could contribute to a higher dollar amount for the opening. 9. Competition: The success will also depend on other movies released around the same time, which we don't know at this point. 10. Critical reception: While we can't predict this, positive reviews could boost opening weekend numbers. question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

Biden's health and age: While Biden's age (81) has been a topic of discussion, there have been no recent indications of severe health issues that would prompt such a drastic decision. 3. Political stability: A sudden resignation of a sitting president would be extremely rare and would likely only occur in cases of severe scandal, health crisis, or national emergency. None of these appear to be present. 4. Time frame: The question specifies a very short time frame (by the end of July 2024), which is less than a month from the creation date of this question. Such a monumental decision would typically require more time and would likely have some preceding indicators. 5. Historical precedent: No U.S. president has ever simultaneously dropped out of a re-election campaign and resigned from office. The rarity of such an event makes it highly improbable. 6. Political consequences: Such a move would be devastating for the Democratic Party, leaving them without a clear candidate very close to the election. It's highly unlikely that Biden would put his party in such a difficult position. 7. Lack of indicators: There have been no credible reports or rumors suggesting Biden is considering either dropping out or resigning, let alone both simultaneously. Given these factors, it is extremely unlikely that Joe Biden would announce both dropping out of the presidential race and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024. While nothing is impossible in politics, this scenario would be unprecedented and there are no current indications pointing towards such a dramatic turn of events.

question.title: Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of S&D (Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats) holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical trends: S&D has been the second-largest group in the European Parliament for several elections, consistently behind the EPP. 3. Recent political shifts: There has been a rise in populist and far-right parties across Europe, which could potentially affect traditional center-left parties like S&D. 4. Brexit impact: The UK's departure from the EU has already affected the composition of the European Parliament, with S&D losing some seats due to the absence of UK Labour MEPs. 5. Current polling: While it's still early, current polls don't show a significant shift towards S&D overtaking EPP. 6. Potential for coalition-building: Even if S&D doesn't win the most seats outright, there's a possibility of forming alliances with other left-leaning groups. 7. Voter turnout and mobilization: S&D's success will depend on their ability to mobilize voters, especially in key countries. 8. Economic and social factors: The state of the European economy and social issues leading up to the election could influence voter preferences. Given these factors, it seems unlikely that S&D will hold the most seats after the 2024 elections. While political landscapes can change rapidly, there isn't strong evidence suggesting a major shift that would propel S&D to the top position. The EPP has maintained a consistent lead, and other political groups are also competing for seats. However, elections can be unpredictable, and there's still time for significant changes before 2024. Therefore, while it's improbable, it's not impossible for S&D to gain the most seats.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?

Uncertainty: The exact number and composition of INAs are not known at this time, which adds uncertainty to the prediction. Given these factors, I believe there's a reasonable chance that INAs could win 15 or more gold medals, but it's not a certainty. The historical performance of ROC athletes in Tokyo suggests it's achievable, but various factors could make it more challenging this time.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical trends: Looking at recent data, the Core CPI has been increasing at a rate above 0.1% month-over-month for most months in the past few years. This suggests a tendency for continued increases above 0.1%. 2. Federal Reserve policy: The Fed has been implementing measures to control inflation. By July 2024, these policies may have had more time to take effect, potentially slowing the rate of increase. 3. Economic recovery: As the economy continues to recover from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, there might be ongoing upward pressure on prices. 4. Seasonal factors: July typically doesn't have strong seasonal effects on Core CPI, so this is less likely to be a major factor. 5. Time frame: The question is about July 2024, which is about a year away from the current date. This long time frame increases uncertainty. 6. Recent trends: In the months leading up to August 2023, Core CPI increases have been moderating but still generally above 0.1%. 7. Global economic factors: International trade, supply chain issues, and global economic conditions can influence US inflation, and these factors are difficult to predict a year in advance. Given these considerations, it seems more likely than not that the Core CPI will increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024. The historical trend and ongoing economic recovery suggest continued upward pressure on prices. However, the effectiveness of Fed policies to control inflation and the long time frame introduce significant uncertainty.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by 0.1% or less in July?
question.body:
